page.title: 13Cilcain/Pantymwun: Services
page.content: The houses within the villages are now supplied with the major services of mains water, sewage and electricity. Both Cilcain and Pantymwyn have a public-house and a general store/post- office, which provide basic foodstuffs and other supplies. Small shops such as these stock only a limited range of products and have to charge higher prices than supermarkets; there is always the threat that lack of custom (due to local people shopping in town) will force these shops to close. There is a primary school in Cilcain and Pantymwyn is served by one at Gwernaffield, just to the east. For other services,such as doctor,dentist, bank,larger shops or secondary schools the villagers must travel to Mold (6km from Cilcain):specialized requirements might entail a trip to Chester or Wrexham (about 30km).
